title: Order 2020 (S.I. No. 452 of 2020)) and after consultation with the Minister for
heading: 1. (1) This Order may be cited as the Valuation Act 2001 (Global Valuation)
text_raw:
1. (1) This Order may be cited as the Valuation Act 2001 (Global Valuation) 
(Apportionment) (RTÉ Transmission Network Designated Activity Company) 
Order 2021. 

(2) In this Order “Act of 2001” means the Valuation Act 2001 (No. 13 of 

2001).
text_norm: 1 (1) order may cited valuation act 2001 (global valuation) (apportionment) (rte transmission network designated activity company) order 2021 (2) order act 2001 mean valuation act 2001 (no 13 2001)

title: Order 2020 (S.I. No. 452 of 2020)) and after consultation with the Minister for
heading: 2. (1) The Commissioner shall apportion the global valuation of RTÉ
text_raw:
2. (1) The Commissioner shall apportion the global valuation of RTÉ 
Transmission Network Designated Activity Company, determined pursuant to 
section 53(6)(a) of the Act of 2001, between each of the rating authorities in 
whose areas property comprised in the valuation is situate in accordance with 
paragraph (2). 

(2) The apportionment referred to in paragraph (1) shall be in the proportion, 
expressed as a percentage, that the population resident in the area of each such 
rating authority, as determined by the census of population taken under the 
Statistics (Census of Population) Order 2015 (No. 445 of 2015), bears to the total 
population of those rating authorities as so determined.
text_norm: 2 (1) commissioner shall apportion global valuation rte transmission network designated activity company determined pursuant section 53(6)(a) act 2001 rating authority whose area property comprised valuation situate accordance paragraph (2) (2) apportionment referred paragraph (1) shall proportion expressed percentage population resident area rating authority determined census population taken statistic (census population) order 2015 (no 445 2015) bear total population rating authority determined

title: Order 2020 (S.I. No. 452 of 2020)) and after consultation with the Minister for
heading: In respect of the period for which an existing valuation list remains in
text_raw:
3. 

In respect of the period for which an existing valuation list remains in 
force in relation to the area of a rating authority to which Article 2 refers, the 
valuation apportioned to such authority under that Article shall be multiplied by 
a factor of 0.002343 to establish the adjusted global valuation for the area of the 
rating authority to be specified in the central valuation list pursuant to section 58 
of the Act of 2001.
text_norm: 3 respect period existing valuation list remains force relation area rating authority article 2 refers valuation apportioned authority article shall multiplied factor 0.002343 establish adjusted global valuation area rating authority specified central valuation list pursuant section 58 act 2001

title: Order 2020 (S.I. No. 452 of 2020)) and after consultation with the Minister for
heading: 4. (1) The apportioned and adjusted global valuation for each rating
text_raw:
4. (1) The apportioned and adjusted global valuation for each rating 
authority determined in accordance with this Order, shall, subject to paragraph 
(2), be rounded to the nearest whole euro. 

(2) Where the apportioned and adjusted global valuation referred to in 
paragraph (1) results in the amount concerned being an amount in euro and 50 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 1st October, 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 cent or greater than 50 cent that amount shall be rounded upwards to the nearest 
whole euro. 

[502] 3 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

29 September, 2021. 

HEATHER HUMPHREYS, 

Minister for Justice.

title: Order 2020 (S.I. No. 452 of 2020)) and after consultation with the Minister for
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE: 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation). 

This order provides for the apportionment of the global valuation of RTÉ 
Transmission Network Designated Activity Company, between each of the 
rating authorities in whose areas property comprised in the valuation of RTÉ 
Transmission Network Designated Activity Company 
is situated. The 
apportionment for each rating authority is to be determined by population within 
rating authority area, according to the Census of Population published by the 
Central Statistics Office. The Order sets out an adjustment factor, determined by 
the Commissioner of Valuation, to make the valuation relative to existing 
valuation lists in those rating authorities which have not to date undergone a 
revaluation under Part 5 of the Valuation Acts 2001 to 2015. 

 
 
 
 
 
 [502] 5
